classification.chemicalStructure: Contains both phenethylamine and tryptamine groups

legalStatus.consequences: Criminalization creates barriers to research and safe use

firstTimeUserDemographics.harmReductionPractices: commonly use familiar settings with close friends

emergencyRoomVisits.context: Of all LSD users seeking emergency care

minidose.description: Between micro and threshold, some perceptual effects

egoDissolution.description: Doses at or above this considered high/capable of inducing ego-dissolution

overwhelmingDoses.description: Extremely high doses producing overwhelming effects

doseResponseRelationship.description: Effects increase with dose; positive effects plateau around 100 mcg while anxiety risk increases at higher doses

subjectiveEffects.intensity: Can be more intense than other illicit substances
subjectiveEffects.variability: Highly individualized, influenced by set and setting

addictionPotential.dependence: Does not typically cause physical dependence

preparations.description: Small squares of paper impregnated with LSD
risks: Dosage uncertainty due to uneven distribution
Cold spots with little to no LSD

preparations.description: LSD dissolved in water or alcohol

risks: Users may redose before first dose takes effect
safetyConsiderations: Wait adequate time before considering redosing

risks: Faster onset leads to more intense experience

lsdSpecificRiskFactors.name: High Dose Effects

heartRate.finding: Peak heart rate >100 bpm in 25% at 200 mcg

lsdSpecificRiskFactors.doseResponseRelationship: Clear increase in adverse effects with dose

specificConditions.prevalence: 87% worsening in those with negative responses

postExperiencePsychiatricDiagnosis.context: Developed psychiatric diagnosis after negative psychedelic experience

lsdSpecificRiskFactors.name: Young Age (<25 years)
mechanisms: Psychological impact of intense experiences in developing brain

lsdSpecificRiskFactors.name: Prior Negative Psychedelic Experiences
lsdSpecificRiskFactors.description: History of challenging experiences increases future risk

lsdSpecificRiskFactors.name: Stressful Life Events or Circumstances
lsdSpecificRiskFactors.description: Major life changes or ongoing stress increase risk
lsdSpecificRiskFactors.recommendation: Consider postponing use until life circumstances stabilize

lsdSpecificRiskFactors.name: Cardiovascular Conditions
lsdSpecificRiskFactors.description: Pre-existing heart conditions pose elevated risk

lsdDrugInteractions.recommendation: Avoid combination; taper SSRIs under medical supervision if psychedelic use planned

lsdDrugInteractions.effects: Variable - may reduce or exacerbate difficulty

conditions.rationale: LSD can worsen symptoms, trigger hallucinations/delusions
LSD increases BP and HR; may trigger cardiovascular events
Lack of safety research; potential fetal effects unknown
May increase seizure risk due to stimulating effects
Intense psychological effects may exacerbate feelings of hopelessness or despair
Heightened risk of negative experience; requires careful screening and support
May trigger manic episodes in vulnerable individuals
conditions.note: Some evidence suggests safety in controlled settings for Bipolar II

conditions.rationale: Risk of trauma reactivation; may be therapeutic with proper support
LSD may amplify suspicion, distrust, anxiety, leading to paranoia
Moderate BP/HR increases may be problematic; requires monitoring

lsdAdverseEvents.name: Acute Anxiety and Panic
lsdAdverseEvents.description: Anxiety and panic reactions during LSD experience
lsdAdverseEvents.prognosis: Usually resolves with session; can escalate without proper support

lsdAdverseEvents.name: Acute Psychotic Symptoms
lsdAdverseEvents.duration: Usually acute but can become prolonged

lsdAdverseEvents.name: Acute Cognitive Impairment
lsdAdverseEvents.functionalImpact: Makes experience disorienting and potentially overwhelming

lsdAdverseEvents.name: Ego Dissolution
lsdAdverseEvents.doseRelationship: More common at higher doses (200+ mcg)
lsdAdverseEvents.description: Loss of sense of self or identity
lsdAdverseEvents.individualVariability: Highly dependent on preparation, set, setting, and support

lsdAdverseEvents.name: Trauma Reactivation
lsdAdverseEvents.description: Triggering recall of past traumatic experiences
lsdAdverseEvents.dualNature: Can be destabilizing or therapeutically valuable with proper support

lsdAdverseEvents.name: Suicidal Ideation and Self-Harm
lsdAdverseEvents.description: Thoughts or acts of self-harm during experience
lsdAdverseEvents.causality: Direct link unclear; may reflect underlying issues

lsdAdverseEvents.name: Cardiovascular Effects
lsdAdverseEvents.lifeThreateningRisk: Low in healthy individuals; elevated in cardiovascular disease

lsdAdverseEvents.name: Other Physical Symptoms
lsdAdverseEvents.duration: Typically subside after effects wear off

lsdAdverseEvents.name: Overdose
lsdAdverseEvents.mortality: Accidental deaths documented but very rare

lsdAdverseEvents.name: Hallucinogen Persisting Perception Disorder (HPPD)

prevalence.finding: 15% reported visual disturbances without further drug use
10% reported long-term perceptual changes when asked directly
69% of former LSD users reported flashbacks

prevalence.note: Rates may be inflated due to methodological concerns

lsdAdverseEvents.onsetPattern: Can occur after single use but more common with chronic use

clinicalTrials.contemporary: No cases reported in contemporary clinical trials
clinicalTrials.context: Thought to be less common in controlled settings

lsdAdverseEvents.subjectiveExperience: Some experience as non-harmful or meaningful; others find distressing

lsdAdverseEvents.name: Flashbacks
lsdAdverseEvents.description: Spontaneous recurrence of aspects of LSD experience
lsdAdverseEvents.relationship: Sometimes linked to HPPD but can occur independently

prevalence.context: Uncontrolled LSD-like experiences without further drug use

lsdAdverseEvents.name: Prolonged Psychotic Reactions

prevalence.context: Of those with bad experiences developed extended psychosis
Range in studies; higher in psychiatric patients

lsdAdverseEvents.context: More common in uncontrolled settings and vulnerable individuals

lsdAdverseEvents.name: Persistent Anxiety and Depression

prevalence.context: Anxiety symptoms arose or worsened in those with negative psychological responses

lsdAdverseEvents.description: Worsening or new onset of anxiety or depression after LSD use
lsdAdverseEvents.duration: Variable; can persist for weeks to months

lsdAdverseEvents.name: Personality Changes
lsdAdverseEvents.historicalClaims: Chronic LSD use associated with personality changes in older literature
lsdAdverseEvents.temporaryShifts: Some individuals may experience temporary shifts in sense of self or behavior
lsdAdverseEvents.permanentChanges: No solid evidence for permanent alterations

lsdAdverseEvents.name: Long-Term Suicidality
lsdAdverseEvents.causality: Unclear; may relate to pre-existing issues
lsdAdverseEvents.context: More common with underlying mental health conditions

lsdAdverseEvents.name: New Psychiatric Diagnoses Post-Use

prevalence.context: Diagnosed with psychiatric condition after psychedelic experience
Developed schizophrenia or delusional disorder 25 years after LSD treatment
Developed bipolar or depressive disorder 25 years after LSD treatment

lsdAdverseEvents.note: More common in individuals with pre-existing vulnerabilities
lsdAdverseEvents.causality: Complex; may unmask latent conditions or exacerbate vulnerabilities

lsdAdverseEvents.name: Long-Term Cardiovascular Effects
lsdAdverseEvents.description: Potential long-term cardiovascular effects not well understood
lsdAdverseEvents.recommendation: More research needed; caution with long-term regular use

lsdAdverseEvents.name: Neurotoxicity
lsdAdverseEvents.description: Long-term effects on brain not well understood
findings: Some studies suggest potential neurotoxic effects
Others find no evidence of neurotoxicity
Generally considered to have low neurotoxicity

lsdMicrodosingAdverseEvents.name: Microdosing Psychological Effects
lsdMicrodosingAdverseEvents.duration: Usually transient; 1-3% report effects lasting days
lsdMicrodosingAdverseEvents.doseDependence: More common at higher microdoses (15-20 mcg)

cardiovascular.heartRate: Mixed findings; some studies show no change, others note increases

lsdMicrodosingAdverseEvents.name: Perceptual Effects at Microdose
lsdMicrodosingAdverseEvents.description: Some users report noticeable psychoactive effects even at microdoses

lsdMicrodosingAdverseEvents.name: Long-Term Microdosing Effects
lsdMicrodosingAdverseEvents.rarity: 1-3% report negative effects beyond typical duration

hppd.note: More commonly associated with full doses

flashbacks.prevalence: Rare (2% noted with mescaline; similar likely for LSD)

lsdMicrodosingAdverseEvents.name: Reasons for Microdosing Discontinuation
lsdMicrodosingAdverseEvents.pattern: Especially when psychological and physical effects occur together

issues.description: Variable LSD content in illicit supplies
Multiple attempts needed to find optimal dose

lsdMicrodosingAdverseEvents.name: Microdosing with Other Substances
lsdMicrodosingAdverseEvents.userBehavior: Some avoid microdosing when physically unwell or using other substances

lsdMicrodosingAdverseEvents.name: Expectation Effects
lsdMicrodosingAdverseEvents.concern: Expectation of effects can confound results
lsdMicrodosingAdverseEvents.context: Particularly in studies using microdose as placebo
lsdMicrodosingAdverseEvents.implication: Difficult to separate true drug effects from expectancy

contaminationQualityIssues.name: Variable Potency in Blotter Paper
contaminationQualityIssues.description: Uneven distribution of LSD across blotter paper
contaminationQualityIssues.mechanism: LSD may not be evenly applied to paper
consequences: Cold spots with little or no LSD
Weak or no effects from some portions
contaminationQualityIssues.microdosing: Particularly problematic for microdosing where precision needed

contaminationQualityIssues.name: Adulteration with NBOMes
contaminationQualityIssues.differentialDiagnosis: NBOMes have bitter taste; LSD is tasteless

contaminationQualityIssues.name: Atropine-like Contamination
contaminationQualityIssues.description: Illicitly manufactured LSD contaminated with atropine-like substances

contaminationQualityIssues.name: Misidentification in Drug Supply
contaminationQualityIssues.description: LSD found in samples sold as other drugs
contaminationQualityIssues.implication: Highlights unreliability of illicit drug market

contaminationQualityIssues.name: Contamination Increasing Serotonin Syndrome Risk
contaminationQualityIssues.description: Contaminated LSD combined with serotonergic drugs
contaminationQualityIssues.mechanism: Unknown adulterants may potentiate serotonin effects
contaminationQualityIssues.risk: Serotonin toxicity when combined with SSRIs, MAOIs

contaminationQualityIssues.name: Lack of Quality Control in Illicit Market
contaminationQualityIssues.description: No regulatory oversight of illicit LSD

harmReductionStrategies.name: Substance Testing

methods.description: Taking small amount to assess purity/potency
methods.prevalence: 31.3% of first-time users took test dose

harmReductionStrategies.bitterTaste: If blotter tastes bitter, it's likely not LSD - spit it out

harmReductionStrategies.name: Start Low, Go Slow
harmReductionStrategies.description: Begin with low doses, especially for first-time users
recommendations: Wait for full effects before considering more
Gradual dose increase if continuing use

harmReductionStrategies.name: Optimize Set and Setting
harmReductionStrategies.firstTimeUsers: 79.6% took LSD with close friend, group of friends, or partner

harmReductionStrategies.name: Trip Sitter/Trusted Support Person
harmReductionStrategies.description: Experienced, sober person present during experience

harmReductionStrategies.name: Avoid Polydrug Use
harmReductionStrategies.description: Do not combine LSD with other substances
harmReductionStrategies.generalRule: Use LSD alone, not in combination
harmReductionStrategies.deathData: 82% of psychedelic-related deaths involved polydrug use

harmReductionStrategies.name: Medication Review
harmReductionStrategies.description: Review all medications before LSD use

harmReductionStrategies.name: Integration Support
harmReductionStrategies.description: Processing and making meaning of experience
harmReductionStrategies.timing: Begin 1-2 days post-session, continue for weeks to months

harmReductionStrategies.name: Volumetric Dosing for Microdosing
harmReductionStrategies.method: Dissolve known quantity of LSD in measured volume of liquid

harmReductionStrategies.name: Trusted Sources
harmReductionStrategies.limitation: Still no guarantee in unregulated market

harmReductionStrategies.name: Access to Crisis Support
harmReductionStrategies.prevention: Can prevent need for emergency services

assess: Personal history of psychosis, bipolar, severe depression
Family history of psychotic disorders, bipolar
Current use of alcohol, cannabis, other drugs

clinicalConsiderations.name: Enhanced Informed Consent
clinicalConsiderations.description: Comprehensive consent process specific to psychedelics

interventions.description: Remind experience is temporary, drug-related, safe

researchGaps.description: Individual dose optimization not well understood
Limited evidence on optimal integration approaches
Conflicting evidence on long-term brain effects
How LSD produces therapeutic benefits unclear

metadata.geographicScope: Global, emphasis on North America and Europe
metadata.evidenceQuality: Variable by topic; strongest for acute effects, weaker for long-term outcomes
knownLimitations: Illicit use data less reliable than clinical
metadata.clinicalTrialsData: Multiple clinical trials but smaller scale than other psychedelics
